p: As discussed earlier, the consequences of climate change on a variety of human diseases can be well examined based on two components: Emergence and re-emergence of pathogenic diseases, vectors, and favorable conditions for transmission and infectious disease outbreaks post weather events. Moreover, as the discussion is in context of human beings, human response and adaptation efficacy can be vital in mitigating the adverse impacts of climate change. The interconnections between climate change, extreme weather events, diseases, and human responses, forming the rationale for the present literature search, are illustrated in Figure 1.
